Name: Jitendra Bhatnagar
Title: No photography!!
Review: I have just written a review of the Gallery. I would like to add that taking photographs here not allowed, which is a big disappointment. i wonder why photography is prohibited. It must visit place.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Nawabi portrait collection
Review: The picture gallery hosts a dozen paintings of all the Nawabs of Lucknow in a small single hall. Visit the place if you care to see them in their royal attire, framed in large size canvas work.

Name: silva s
Title: Small quiet place
Review: The portraits of nababs are kept here. The paintings are beautiful. The lustrous silk dresses, the bespoke jewelries or even the shadow of the zafri is painted by master painters. Some pics are kind of 3D. Definitely a glorious past of Indian art history.

Name: JoyBose
Title: Photo gallery of all the nawabs of lucknow
Review: It has a gallery of all the nawabs of lucknow from safdar jung to wajid ali shah. You can get a guide as well. No photos allowed inside but outside photos can be taken and has a good view of old lucknow heritage buildings.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Gallery is small
Review: There's a small visiting fee about RS 20 for Indians and high rates for foreigners . It's small gallery one can visit here if they are interested in art and history .

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: Nawabs' Portraits
Review: The Picture Gallery houses portraits of the erstwhile nawabs of Awadh. The portraits were quite fine, with intricate details. The caretaker also pointed out to us a few amazing bits here & there. Like how the nawab's shoes seem to move!Our minds were also blown off by the view that the Gallery offered. The Clock Tower to the left, Chhota Imambara straight ahead, & the Satkhanda to the right.Photography is prohibited. The Husainabad Picture Gallery also doesn't seem to be frequented by tourists. We'd the place almost to ourselves.

Name: durham05
Title: Small gallery
Review: Small gallery with some portraits of the rulers of Lucknow. Guide thrust himself onto me but all he did when he took me round was to read off the captions on the bottom of the photos. Rushed me by some of the more interesting historic photographs of Lucknow and then told me the 50 rupees I offered was too small! Not impressed.

Name: melb0urnemuzza
Title: Did not go
Review: Admission price asked was 500 rupees even though the board stated 200 which is what I expected.I turned around!

Name: FATBOY
Title: HUSAINABAD PICTURE GALLERY
Review: This picture gallery shows big oil painting of Nawabs of Awadhi. The entry fee for Indian/foreigners is ₹20/₹200.The work on these paintings is actually quite good. It you want the staff to give you summary of the history of the house of Nawabs then you have to pay more. There is a big water tank (Baoli) in front of the building. This gallery is near Rumi Darwaza, Lucknow.History seekers can have a awesome time here.Note: Taking pictures is strictly prohibited here.Timing: 0800 hrs to 1700hrs

Name: Krupabn
Title: Nice pictures but bad maintenance
Review: The gallery houses 10 - 12 life size pictures of Nawabs which is 3D and optical illusions created in painting are amazing. There are no details mentioned anywhere so forced to hire guide who are overly priced for such a small tour. It's not a gallery just a room of pictures.. Outside view is worst.. You can see filth everywhere, very badly needs some maintenance.

Name: Praveen Singh
Title: 10 - 12 painting
Review: This picture gallery contains around 10 to 12 huge 3D paintings. Observing the 3D effect of these paintings is really good once must definitely visit. You will find paintings of various Nawabs of Lucknow here. This can be covered with in 20 mins .

Name: Ajeet N
Title: Nice paitings
Review: A collection of 9 to 10 life-size paintings commissioned by the nawabs and drawn by European painters.Each painting has a nawab and the building that he created, in the background. Gives a lesson in history.

Name: Indraneel
Title: Interesting - Could have been better
Review: Hussainabad Picture Gallery was my last stop during my Lucknow visit. This place is next to Rumi Darwaza and the Clock Tower. The gallery is housed in a beautiful building made by the third Nawad of Awadh and has some rare life-size portraits of the various Nawabs of Awadh painted by British artists and one Indian Painter Mr. D K Singh. The portraits are really interesting and has elements of optical illusion in them.This place is ticketed and the cost is included in the combo ticket available in Bada Imambada.Pro:- The building housing the gallery is beautiful. Watch out for- Iron pillars in the upper story pavilion facing the lake - used first time in Nawabi building- Bowling alley or Gendghar build by Mohammad Ali Shah for the Britishers- Rare Pictures; believed to be made on elephant skin and the colors used were prepared from diamonds and other precious stonesCons:- Picture Gallery is a misnomer as it is just a large hall with pictures & paintings on all the four walls.- The paintings and the pictures have no detailing. Forced to take guide at high cost.- Photography is strictly prohibited - reason best known only to the administrators- Unprofessional maintenance,Viewing time : 20 mins

Name: 592abck
Title: Not many pictures
Review: I am an art lover but I was disappointed due to very less pictures. I am not sure why they don't increase them.

Name: Teja
Title: It's just ok
Review: Some of the paintings of the nawabs of Lucknow are quite well done. But otherwise it's just a gallery of items associated with them, without any particular guidance on which ones are significant, etc. Also, you can't take any pictures inside, so by now I've forgotten pretty much everything.

Name: saurabh k
Title: Guides are irritating, they force you to take them to see picture gallery.
Review: You will see 3d photo of mughals and other kings, nice place to visit if you are interested in the the history.But the thing that irritate me is that agent are present on the gate of this gallery and they recommand you to go with them to see picture gallery. If they show you the gallery they take extra charge for it.So i highly recommand not to take guide with you.

Name: amars777
Title: Rare Collections
Review: Some old and rare collection of paintings and photographs are displayed here. Photography is strictly prohibited. Reason best known to the keepers.....

Name: randhirt2017
Title: Must watch this place for artist and also non-artist
Review: its a amazing place,a must visit for art lovers,collection of beatiful paintings,everyone should visit .

Name: akg_9
Title: A few pictures at a high entry fee
Review: The main attraction here is a room full of portraits of rulers of Lucknow, which appears to be highly priced at an entry fee of Rs.50.

Name: knightrider02
Title: Amazing paintigs
Review: Picture gallery have some amazing paintings. Paintings have some kind of 3D effect. E.g. Nawab's shoe direction will change as you walk past the picture. One of the photo, one will feel that Nawab is looking at them and person standing at other side will feel that Nawab is looking at them. Guide will walk you through all the photos, history and amazing facts.

Name: naveen_oberoi
Title: Nice Gallery
Review: Picture gallery is very to husainabad clock tower. if you are a history lover, you can enjoy some beautiful paints of the kings of ancient time. I was disappointed as they don't allow photography. Rest a worth visiting place.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Historical&Beautiful
Review: This is a historical place of lucknow. Very beautiful inside and outside. If you are a history lover then definitely go here.

Name: arindammullick100
Title: Historical Importance
Review: Not Large Gallery...... half an hour visit is okay...Gallery is on the first floor ..... Recommend to take a guide, available on first floor, to understand the marvelous art in paintings..... other than guide it will be just some ordinary paintings

Name: mohd a
Title: Historical museum.
Review: It's a good place for history lovers. In this museum you will know many thing about the Lucknow and their kings.

Name: Seema H
Title: Beautiful pictures
Review: The Hussainabad picture Gallery is close to the Clock Tower and the Imambara. The picture gallery has some beautiful paintings, but you need a guide to explain the history behind them. For me ,it was a disappointment as photography was not allowed . Not many tourists were visiting the place, so we were able to view the pictures comfortably.

Name: Alok N
Title: BEST ART GALLERY UNFORTUNATELY POORLY DESIGNED
Review: One of the best Art Gallery but poorly designed ( lighting and space ) and not promoted properly. Located between Bara and Chota Imambara it is easily accessible but not many tourists go there. The Paintings are just ' fantastic' but you need to have a guide to give the history and explain the intricacies of each to really understand and appreciate them. Photography NOT ALLOWED.

Name: kalpajeetbhattachary
Title: Art lover will never be disappointed
Review: Hussainabad Picture Gallery of Lucknow is situated near the Chhota Imambara and the Gallery Building is visible from the main road. The Pictures here are amazingly maintained and one can not tell whether they are so old. It can be compared to any good art gallery and an art lover will never be disappointed. Must visit if one can appreciate paintings. Some paintings are said to have been made on elephant skin. Also, the so called `famed' paintings which seem to look straight to the viewer from almost all angles (it is an optical illusion, with the subject looking straight ahead), are here.

Name: Ronak J
Title: Good place
Review: A must watch place .with such an alluring picture gallery this place give me a calming effect. Good place

Name: souvikjana83
Title: For Art Lovers
Review: The Pictures here are amazingly maintained and one cant tell whether they are so old.. It can be compared to any good art gallery and an art lover will never be dissapointed.. Must visit if one can appreciate paintings..

Name: Sajeed K
Title: Amazing Collection
Review: Hussainabad Picture Gallery in Lucknow is situated near the Chhota Imambara  and the Gallery Building is visible from the main road. Nice image collection is hereThe gallery is open on all days from 08.00 hours in morning to 18.00 hours in evening.

Name: sumantra_travel
Title: Husainabad Picture Gallery, September, 2015.
Review: 19 September, 2015.The Hussainabad Picture gallery has an impressive collection,which can be viewed by climbing a flight of stairs to an upperfloor, and is adjacent to the main road through the Rumi Darwaza.Some paintings are said to have been made on elephant skin.Yes, the so called `famed' paintings which seem to look straightto the viewer from almost all angles (it is an optical illusion,with the subject looking straight ahead), are here. The works ofart are housed mainly in one main gallery, and are in a goodstate of preservation.
